Time
This is a MIT licensed library for the manipulation of dates and periods according to the Gregorian calendar, i.e. the internationally accepted calendar for most uses. The library is built around two concepts:
date: a specific point in time, for example yesterday at 3:00 PM period: a duration of time, for example three hours
with the following characteristics:
dates and periods have microsecond (1-millionth of a second) precision leap years are taken into account all years have the same number of seconds, i.e. there are no leap seconds
